revised_title: Molecular Absorption of Light in Saturated Aliphatic Ketones
tldr: The authors investigated the absorption of light by saturated aliphatic ketones and found that the molecular absorption power of these compounds is the same, provided they are monomolecular and not associated. They also confirmed the electromagnetic force field theory, which explains the origin of absorption in these ketones, and disproved the molecular vibration theory. The study highlights the importance of using pure ketones in absorption measurements to obtain accurate results.
